oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various interviews - Biff Collie - 1976-09-25
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of interviews with Marty Robbins (performer), Roy Acuff (performer), and Jeannie C. Riley (performer), at the Grand Ole Opry on September 25, 1976.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie asks Marty Robbins about a new television show -- Marty Robbins impersonates Hank Snow -- Marty Robbins talks about the television show, the Marty Robbins Spotlight -- Robbins talks about not knowing if the show will be successful or not -- Robbins talks about how the show is a spotlight for different artists -- Robbins talks about how he thinks either Art Satherly or Don Law should be inducted to the Hall of Fame -- Robbins talks about being fed up with some fans -- Robbins talks about his favorite recording of his being El Paso -- Robbins talks about his other ideas for El Paso -- Robbins talks about believing we are predestined to be what we end up being -- Robbins talks about not pursuing other business endeavors -- Robbins talks about land being the best investment -- Robbins talks about wanting his son to pursue a music career -- Robbins talks about Hank Williams Jr. -- Roy Acuff does some impersonations -- Roy Acuff talks about feeling good -- Acuff talks about not knowing who will be inducted to the Hall of Fame -- Acuff says he is glad he doesn't know because he would tell somebody -- Acuff talks about the changes he would like to see in country music, which are namely in the music mixing -- Acuff talks about what the younger audiences like, which is music they can dance to -- Acuff talks about some artists being clean cut and others having long hair and beards -- Acuff talks about recording with Willie Nelson -- Acuff says if he was Willie Nelson he would never try to represent the Grand Ole Opry, because of his outlaw persona -- Acuff talks about there being very few original young performers -- Acuff talks about Johnny Cash and Roy Clark being the most original when he was coming up -- Acuff talks about his favorite song being Peace In The Valley by Red Foley, and being more partial to gospel ballads -- Biff Collie concludes the interview -- Jeannie C. Riley talks about how important the Grand Ole Opry is -- Riley talks about it being an honor to play the Opry -- Riley talks about driving to Tom T. Hall's house to show a friend
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Robbins, Marty; Acuff, Roy, 1903-1992; Riley, Jeannie C.;
